required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of 250 ml Versus 500 ml of Fluid Challenge
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of 250 ml Versus 500 ml of Fluid Challenge on Oxygen Consumption in Critical Care Patients: an Open Label Multicentre Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of fluid challenge is to increase oxygen delivery (DO2) in order to improve/restore tissue oxygen consuption (VO2). However the fluid challenge volume to administer stills in debate, some studies recommend to administer 250 mL. Previous studies suggested that 500 mL of fluid challenge administration may improve cardiac output and oxygen delivery. The relation between the amount of fluid expansion and oxygen delivery and oxygen consumption was not yet been studied in a randomized study in critical care patients. This is the purpose of this study.

primary_outcome.description: Tissue oxygen consumption (VO2) after fluid challenge
Tissue oxygen consumption (VO2) after fluid challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of arterial lactate concentration from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline is the measurement of arterial lactate concentration immediately after fluid challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of arterial lactate concentration from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline is the measurement of arterial lactate concentration immediately after fluid challenge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately, 30 and 60 minutes after fluid challenge.
Immediately, 30 and 60 minutes after fluid challenge.
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory variation of stroke volume after fluid challenge.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately, 30 and 60 minutes after fluid challenge.
secondary_outcome.description: PaO2/FiO2 ratio (ratio of arterial oxygen partial pressure to fractional inspired oxygen) after fluid challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Respiratory variation of the pulse pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory variation of the pulse pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Stroke volume variation with passive leg raising (PLV)
secondary_outcome.description: Stroke volume variation with passive leg raising (PLV)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately, 30 and 60 minutes after fluid challenge.
Immediately, 30 and 60 minutes after fluid challenge.
secondary_outcome.description: Diastolic heart function (E, A, E', A', S' waves)

intervention.description: After randomisation, patient will receive 250 ml or 500 ml of fluid challenge. VO2 will be assessed before fluid challenge, immediately, 30 minutes and 60 minutes after fluid challenge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient for whom the physician in charge decided to infuse fluid challenge because of signs of acute circulatory failure (systolic arterial blood pressure < 90mmHg, and/or mean arterial blood pressure< 65 mmHg, and/or the need of vasopressive amine infusion, and/or skin motling, and/or diuresis <0.5 mL/kg/h for more than 2 hours, and/or arterial lactate level>2mmol/L.
- Echogenic patient
- Patient with a Stroke Volume (SV) variation with passive leg raising (PLR) more than 10%.
- Patient with regular sinus rythm.
- Patient who received protocol information.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age Under 18-year-old.
- Pregnancy.
